thread.title: Mexicans say Melania Trump on cover of Vanity Fair is a 'humiliation'
thread.title_full: Mexicans say Melania Trump on cover of Vanity Fair is a 'humiliation'

author: Hatty Collier
title: Mexicans say Melania Trump on cover of Vanity Fair is a 'humiliation'

organizations.name: mexican vanity fair vanity fair mexico  melania trump

text:
Friday 27 January 2017 11:27 BST Click to followThe Evening Standard Cover shoot: Melania Trump appears on the front of Mexican Vanity Fair Vanity Fair Mexico 
Melania Trump has appeared on the cover of the Mexican edition of Vanity Fair amid rising tensions over Donald Trump‚Äôs pledge to build a wall on the country‚Äôs border with the US. 
The new First Lady appears on the cover of the magazine in a pose as though she is eating from a bowl filled with jewellery. 
In the photo, she wraps a silver necklace from the bowl around a fork like spaghetti as she stares into the camera. 
Throughout the presidential election campaign, Mr Trump repeatedly pledged to build the border wall to keep illegal immigrants out of the US. The new First Lady appears on the cover of Mexican Vanity Fair (Vanity Fair Mexico) 
Mexican‚Äôs President Enrique Pena Nieto has scrapped a planned trip to Washington to meet the new president, who had also demanded that America‚Äôs southern neighbour pay for the wall. 
The photo of Mrs Trump and accompanying interview originally appeared in GQ magazine in the Spring. 
Conde Nast is the parent company of both Vanity Fair Mexico and GQ. 
The release of the cover sparked outrage among some people in Mexico who took to Twitter to express their dismay. 
One person wrote: ‚ÄúWe demand Vanity Fair Mexico not to distribute their magazine with Melania Trump on the cover; it's a mockery and humiliation for Mexico.‚Äù Exigimos a Vanity Fair Mexico no distribuir su magazine con Melania Trump en la portada es una burla y humillaci√≥n para M√©xico ‚Äî alicia martin (@aliciam28368104) January 27, 2017 melania trump desayunando un plato de diamantes en la portada de vanity fair M√âXICO üëéüèº parece broma
